Articles.Content:
I've been playing this game for a couple of weeks now..

Wanted to say HI from Minmus!

![2izyhHm.png](http://i.imgur.com/2izyhHm.png)

Greetings from Earth! Welcome to the forum.

Also, interesting lander you have there. . . do you meet back up with a return vehicle in orbit?

> 
> I've been playing this game for a couple of weeks now..
> Wanted to say HI from Minmus!
> 
> [http://i.imgur.com/2izyhHm.png](http://i.imgur.com/2izyhHm.png)

That is one amazing looking lander! I'm curious about your 'couple of weeks' play -- did that include **any** sleep at all? ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Hi! You've made it farther than me - of course, I'm doing all of my playing [On Camera](youtube.com/c/SimGamerTV).

Welcome!

Great to see someone else who, like me, sends up ships with way too much RCS fuel ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif)

@Newt, absolutely! Can't see it here but the docking port is up on top, was a fine journey!

@Oafman, I'm pretty sure you can't have enough RCS. Docking is a pain.

> 
> @Newt, absolutely! Can't see it here but the docking port is up on top, was a fine journey!
> @Oafman, I'm pretty sure you can't have enough RCS. Docking is a pain.

Once you get good at it, it'll take less than 10 units of RCS fuel. Keep practicing and welcome! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
